newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day peso closes two centavos firm.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day peso closes two centavos firm.

text.p: The peso recouped ground lost to the dollar Wednesday due to local stocks gaining and primary rate hikes, traders said.
"The peso is reacting positively to primary rate hikes and some capital flowing into the Bolsa due to stability in the long bond," a trader said.
Early in the session, the U.S. 30-year Treasury bond held steady after, but it drifted half a point lower before midday.
The same-day peso closed two centavos firmer at 7.551/7.554 per dollar, while 24-hour and 48-hour contracts closed 1.6 and 1.25 centavos firmer at 7.555/7.559 and 7.56/7.565, respectively.
Currency traders said trading volume was thin as investors are cautious in the run up to U.S. employment data being published on Friday.
"People are very calm ... the long-bond has recently been susceptible to this type of indicator," a currency trader said.
